newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dismal June ends poor H1 for German retailers.
newsitem.headline: Dismal June ends poor H1 for German retailers.

text.p: A dismal June rounded off a poor first half for German retailers, who are gearing up for longer shopping hours next month amid weak consumer demand, data showed on Tuesday.

The Federal Statistics Office said retail sales fell 1.3 percent in real terms in January-June 1996 compared with the first half of 1995. In June, seasonally adjusted sales shrank 4.4 percent from June 1995 after an easing of 3.4 percent in May.

The gloomy outlook for the German retail sector -- into its fourth year of stagnation or declining turnover -- was confirmed by an operating statement released by Metro AG, the country's largest retail chain.

Metro, announcing nine-month results, said slackness in consumer spending had continued into the third quarter. It also said it would revise down its medium-term sales forecasts to take account of expectations that there will be no improvement next year.
